header.aside: Falafel, tahini and halloumi wrap... What a tasty bite of sunshine! This quick and easy Mediterranean veggie wrap is my first Lila, Chop! savoury recipe.

section.p: Going back to my culinary adventure in Egypt, back when I was still a vegetarian. I realised the Egyptians were especially good at making falafel, and I wondered why the locals found vegetarians so bizarre when they made such wonderful vegetarian dishes! The combination of tahini, falafel and halloumi in a wrap was simply genius, and whenever I found myself indecisive about what to order, particularly at dubious-looking places, I always defaulted to that tasty comfort dish. Easy to make and convenient to eat on-the-go, I decided to recreate it as my first Lila, Chop! savoury recipe.

The falafel I used were pre-made and store-bought. However, you can make your own using this Gluten Free Falafel Mix from Amazon.
Even better: make your own falafel from scratch using this Protein Falafel recipe by Anna Sward, author and and founder of Proteinpow. She used pea protein powder in her falafel recipe.

tr.td: Heat the wrap in the oven at 200'C
Heat the falafel and halloumi in a pan over medium-heat.
Place salad, vegetables, falafel, and cheese in the middle of the wrap.
Fold the wrap closed and stick a toothpick through the middle to keep it closed.

section.p: To make this recipe vegan, simply skip the halloumi cheese.

One of the photos shows this Mediterranean veggie wrap served with a Thai Omelette and broccoli. This was because a certain someone for whom I made this meal would hardly have found a veggie wrap enough for a post-workout dinner. So if you want to up the nutritional value and protein content of this dish, simply make a 3-egg omelette (2 eggs + 1 egg-white) and serve with steamed broccoli on top. The nutritional value will then be: 553cal, 28g protein, 23g carbs & 40g fat. (Don't let the amount of fat scare you; it's all healthy fats!)
